description: [Status: preview] [Name: invalid-bool-return-type] [Message: __bool__ does not return bool] What it does Checks for __bool__ implementations that return a type other than bool. Why is this bad? The __bool__ method should return a bool object. Returning a different type may cause unexpected behavior. Example class Foo: def __bool__(self): return 2 Use instead: class Foo: def __bool__(self): return True
